tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD2-029 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: Prisma Access User Enterprise Edition - includes secure cloud and private application access and outbound internet security (zero trust) for PCC and partners. It covers a premium security subscription with redundant and resilient worldwide service locations including service connections for site-to-site VPN connections and ZTNA connectors. It also login retention for audit and compliance and includes the Secure Enterprise Browser for Internet and private app access from non-PCC devices. tenders.title: How does community nursing feature in End-of-Life care and Palliative Care model
tenders.summary: Community nursing is essential to delivering comprehensive healthcare, particularly in supporting patients with complex and long-term needs. However, there is an acute need for enhanced focus on end-o
tenders.detailedDescription: Community nursing is essential to delivering comprehensive healthcare, particularly in supporting patients with complex and long-term needs. However, there is an acute need for enhanced focus on end-of-life (EoL) and palliative care as due to populations age and the prevalence of chronic illnesses, community nursing teams must be equipped not only for general care but also for the specialised demands of palliative care. This shift is vital to ensure patients receive quality, personalised support in their preferred environment, typically their home or community setting.

tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: T1184 - Blood Sample Collection & Analysis
tenders.summary: Understanding Society: the UK Household Longitudinal Study (UKHLS) is a longitudinal social survey of households and individuals living in the UK. Data collection began in January 2009 and participant
tenders.detailedDescription: Understanding Society: the UK Household Longitudinal Study (UKHLS) is a longitudinal social survey of households and individuals living in the UK. Data collection began in January 2009 and participants are interviewed annually. In Waves 2 and 3 of the Study (2010-13) a wide range of objective health measures were collected via a nurse visit, including venous blood samples from which we produced a range of analytes, extracted DNA and produced genetic and epigenetic data. A similar exercise is being undertaken at Wave 16 (2024-26), where the nurse visit has been replaced by participants collecting samples/measurements themselves.

tenders.title: Westleigh Pumping Borehole
tenders.summary: The Coal Authority (client) invites you to tender for the drilling of a mine water monitoring borehole to assess rising mine water on the surrounding environment at Westleigh, Wigan. A review of the m
tenders.detailedDescription: The Coal Authority (client) invites you to tender for the drilling of a mine water monitoring borehole to assess rising mine water on the surrounding environment at Westleigh, Wigan. A review of the mine water block by the Coal Authority has highlighted that mine water levels in the area could be elevated in respect to the rest of the block. There is potential for elevated mine water levels which could pose a risk to the overlying drinking water aquifers. Therefore, the Coal Authority requires construction of a borehole to intersect flooded underground workings at the former Priestner's Colliery at Westleigh, Wigan. The proposed borehole is to be used to improve understanding of mine water in the Golborne, Bickershaw and Parsonage mine water block and will be used for water level monitoring, water quality sampling and abstraction of water.

tenders.title: Supply and Delivery of Tools, Equipment and Ancillaries
tenders.summary: Birmingham City Council has a statutory duty to maintain its public highways, parks, and open spaces to a high standard of cleanliness and safety. To fulfil this obligation, the Council relies heavily
tenders.detailedDescription: Birmingham City Council has a statutory duty to maintain its public highways, parks, and open spaces to a high standard of cleanliness and safety. To fulfil this obligation, the Council relies heavily on a skilled manual workforce equipped with a wide range of hand tools, power tools, garden tools, and associated ancillaries. These tools are essential for the day-to-day operations carried out across multiple depots, each of which operates its own stores and budgetary controls. Historically, the procurement of tools and equipment has been managed on an ad hoc basis, with quotations sought from multiple suppliers to achieve best value. However, this approach has presented challenges in consistency, delivery times, and administrative efficiency. In response, the Council initiated a formal procurement process to establish a single-source call-off contract under the NEPO219 Building Materials Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS). This route was selected following an options appraisal which identified the DPS as the most suitable framework to ensure compliance with the Procurement Act 2023 and, provided access to the numerous incumbent providers to join the DPS and compete for the Council's business.

tenders.title: Request for Information (RFI): Provision of Historical Space Object Data Sets
tenders.summary: The National Space Strategy and the Defence Space Strategy laid out the ambitious vision of the UK, in the space domain.  They provided a clear strategic direction aimed at delivering improved Space D
tenders.detailedDescription: The National Space Strategy and the Defence Space Strategy laid out the ambitious vision of the UK, in the space domain.  They provided a clear strategic direction aimed at delivering improved Space Domain Awareness (SDA).   In May 2024 the National Space Operations Centre (NSpOC) was launched, led by UK Space Command and the UK Space Agency in partnership with the Met Office.  The NSpOC will combine and coordinate civil and military Space Domain Awareness (SDA) capabilities, to enable UK space operations and protect our interests in space and on Earth from space related threats, risks, and hazards, as per the xGov SDA Requirements Publication.

tenders.title: 704399451-39 - MSS/142 MRO049_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Electrical, Power and Distribution items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: Vector SR Red Light & Spot Speed Safety Cameras
tenders.summary: This contract is required to install 2no Safety Cameras on Myton Way to capture and enforce red light and speeding traffic offences, to overcome road safety concerns. Cleveland Police are currently un
tenders.detailedDescription: This contract is required to install 2no Safety Cameras on Myton Way to capture and enforce red light and speeding traffic offences, to overcome road safety concerns. Cleveland Police are currently unable to enforce red-light traffic offences at this junction, which presents potential road safety concerns. The location has a known history damage-only and casualty accidents, with speeding identified as a key contributing factor. Installing safety cameras to monitor both speed and red-light violations would provide a permanent deterrent, encouraging compliance and enhancing safety for all road users.

tenders.title: DA from the ESPO 509_23 FW for the Pay and Display Parking Solutions
tenders.summary: This contract covers the provision, maintenance, and management of physical pay-and-display parking machines that accept card and cash payments. It also includes the supply of integrated back-office s
tenders.detailedDescription: This contract covers the provision, maintenance, and management of physical pay-and-display parking machines that accept card and cash payments. It also includes the supply of integrated back-office software to support operational oversight, financial reporting, and performance monitoring. We have been operating with Metric, who provide our machines and back office solutions without contract in recent years. This contract formalises our existing arrangements for pay-and-display parking infrastructure and enables the procurement of new machines to replace aging stock. It supports an asset management approach aligned with our commitment, outlined in recent Cabinet reports, to maintain and modernise our parking estate.

tenders.title: 704399451-67 - MSS/142 MRO076_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Mechanical System items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: The NHS England, North East & Yorkshire, Education Investments and Commissioning team hold a government (Education, Skills Funding Agency) contract to deliver apprenticeships to NHS employers for niche apprenticeship programmes not available elsewhere. For all apprenticeships, there is an End Point Assessment (EPA) element mandated at the end of training. This must be carried out by an independent organization to assess the apprentice has met all the criteria of the apprenticeship standard and can certify them as complete. To become an End Point Assessment Organization (EPAO), an organization must become registered on the Department for Education's official 'Apprenticeship Provider and Assessment Register'

tenders.title: DHSC: SC&I: Design for Life Decontamination Capacity Survey.v2
tenders.organization: Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC)
tenders.summary: Design for Life is the Government's programme to build a circular economy for medical products by 2045, delivering increased resilience, economic growth, value for money and sustainability. The progra
tenders.detailedDescription: Design for Life is the Government's programme to build a circular economy for medical products by 2045, delivering increased resilience, economic growth, value for money and sustainability. The programme published its Design for Life roadmap in October 2024, setting out six key barriers ('problem statements') to achieving this vision and a path of 30 actions to overcome them. This project delivers against the 'Physical and digital infrastructure' problem statement and specifically Action 19 to 'survey existing systems' for decontamination.

tenders.summary: The requirement for this project phase is to deliver a proof of concept that explores how uncertainty in river level, river flow, and rain gauge data can be quantified and communicated prior to its us
tenders.detailedDescription: The requirement for this project phase is to deliver a proof of concept that explores how uncertainty in river level, river flow, and rain gauge data can be quantified and communicated prior to its use in hydrological models. The long-term ambition is to develop methods applicable across the full hydrological range, however this phase anticipates focusing on high flows and rainfall only, aligning with FHIP funding availability and its flood-related objectives.

tenders.title: 704399451-89 - MSS/142 MRO100_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of mechanical systems items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: The Trust is undertaking the construction of a new Community Diagnostic Centre (CDC) Building, which requires an upgraded power supply to support its operations. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of electrical propulsion items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: 704399451-69 - MSS/142 MRO075_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of mechanical systems items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD2-021 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: Provision of Non-Invasive Pre-natal Testing
tenders.organization: St George's University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
tenders.summary: Non Invasive Prenatal Testing (NIPT) service based at St George's University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, screening for Down's, Edwards' and Patau's syndromes, in line with UK National Screening Co
tenders.detailedDescription: Non Invasive Prenatal Testing (NIPT) service based at St George's University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, screening for Down's, Edwards' and Patau's syndromes, in line with UK National Screening Committee (UKNSC) recommendations and NHS England requirements. In some instances, fetal sexing is performed in addition to the main trisomy's. The SAFE test has been set up as a collaboration between the Fetal Medicine Unit and the St George's Genomics Service, which is a UKAS accredited medical laboratory. The service provides NIPT to approximately one third of the NHS maternity services in England and several private clinical services

tenders.title: 704471450-MSS/143-PD2-017 CAN
tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: Whitework is an embroidery technique in which the stitch and linen of the same colour, became associated with County Down in the 19th century. tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.summary: The Service is to provide as a minimum six (6) parcels. These must be sent calendar monthly to the Virtual Schools nominated address, as identified for each eligible child. High-quality books from a r
tenders.detailedDescription: The Service is to provide as a minimum six (6) parcels. These must be sent calendar monthly to the Virtual Schools nominated address, as identified for each eligible child. High-quality books from a range of genres, maths games and other high-quality materials, that are age appropriate to support our children's learning, which will support narrowing the gap in education achievements for our children. We expect the Provider to demonstrate how and why materials included in a parcel are chosen. The Council support academic five hundred and thirty (530) children per year. The provider will be able to support additional children should the Council need to add new to care children to the Service each month. For those new to care children, we expect them to receive all parcels from the year.

tenders.title: Lay Advocacy Services
tenders.summary: The Fitness to Practise Directorate is responsible for considering complaints about doctors Physician Associates (PAs) and Anaesthesia Associations (AAs). Anyone can bring a complaint directly to the
tenders.detailedDescription: The Fitness to Practise Directorate is responsible for considering complaints about doctors Physician Associates (PAs) and Anaesthesia Associations (AAs). Anyone can bring a complaint directly to the GMC, including organisations, registrants, patients and their families.(For the purposes of this document a user of the lay advocacy service will be referred to as an individual.) Although we encourage these complaints to be put in writing, there are times when that is not possible or they experience difficulties putting their complaint in writing. Where this is the case, we require an independent lay advocacy service to assist in taking the complaints verbally. The lay advocacy service will also assist and engage with individuals throughout the investigation process where required.

tenders.title: Toxicology Services
tenders.summary: Where there are concerns about a registrant's physical or mental health, we may require the registrant to undergo a health assessment. This may form one part of a wider investigation into a registrant
tenders.detailedDescription: Where there are concerns about a registrant's physical or mental health, we may require the registrant to undergo a health assessment. This may form one part of a wider investigation into a registrant's fitness to practise. At the end of an investigation, a registrant may enter into a period of medical supervision to monitor their health condition and compliance with any restrictions on their registration. Toxicology testing is required as part of the GMC's Fitness to Practise proceedings in order to establish:a) if and what substances have been/are being used by the registrant (this is of particular help in health assessments)b) if the registrant has complied with undertakings or conditions (which is of particular help for the purposes of medical supervision).This is mostly done using blood, in particular PEth testing, and hair testing at present, although nail, saliva, urine and breath tests can be carried out at the GMC's discretion.

tenders.summary: This project aims to procure an analytical platform, that is robust, scalable, user-friendly and capable of combining methods across analytical disciplines to improve the DfT's Crisis Response and Res
tenders.detailedDescription: This project aims to procure an analytical platform, that is robust, scalable, user-friendly and capable of combining methods across analytical disciplines to improve the DfT's Crisis Response and Resilience capabilities. Recognising the rapid pace of change in technology and the range of possible technological methodologies, DfT is using an outcomes-based approach to enable innovation and use of novel data and technologies.â¯ The aim of this work is to create a national platform capable of identifying disruptions across transport modes in a timely fashion and appropriate level of detail, combining a variety of data sources, estimate and inform users of their likely impact to people and goods, track developments, model potential interventions and gather learnings for future use.

tenders.summary: North Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) is seeking tenders for the provision of vehicle operations in support of its Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) Service. The Authority is seeking to appoint a
tenders.detailedDescription: North Lincolnshire Council (the Authority) is seeking tenders for the provision of vehicle operations in support of its Demand Responsive Transport (DRT) Service. The Authority is seeking to appoint a suitable Provider to support the Authority in achieving the key council outcome of Connected, which is the ability for the population of North Lincolnshire to be able to access employment, education, social and leisure opportunities regardless of where they live.  The aim is to provide suitable coverage of DRT across the Authority that provides key connections primarily but not exclusively to and from isolated rural areas. Where possible the ability to encourage modal shift from single occupancy car journeys in particular also needs to be promoted.

tenders.title: Cwmystwyth Planning and  Design
tenders.summary: The principle, long term objective of the Cwmystwyth project is the reduction of metal loadings entering the Afon Ystwyth from the Cwmystwyth site. The proposed works aim to significantly reduce (by u
tenders.detailedDescription: The principle, long term objective of the Cwmystwyth project is the reduction of metal loadings entering the Afon Ystwyth from the Cwmystwyth site. The proposed works aim to significantly reduce (by up to 50% immediately downstream) concentrations / loadings of dissolved lead and zinc in the Ystwyth, as well as a significant (but currently unquantifiable) reduction in the amount of fine grained, metal rich sediment newly entering the main river system through erosion of exposed spoil and in channel deposits at Cwmystwyth (and associated dissolved phase contamination from leaching). The works aim to directly improve a stretch, estimated at 7km, of the river downstream of Cwmystwyth.

tenders.title: Fire Houses Refurbishment Programme - CPA/SPU/2743F - (Lot 9 Fusion21 Framework) - AWARD
tenders.summary: Cheshire Fire and Rescue Service owns a portfolio of 56 residential houses, at 6 different locations across Cheshire. The properties have been the subject of a programme of refurbishment work to bring
tenders.detailedDescription: Cheshire Fire and Rescue Service owns a portfolio of 56 residential houses, at 6 different locations across Cheshire. The properties have been the subject of a programme of refurbishment work to bring them up to required standards under Contract CPA/SPU/1267F over the last 5 years, with that contract period ending March 2025.  The contract was established under the Fusion21 framework of the time.  This work has included Roofs, Insulation, Kitchens, Bathrooms, Adaptions and External works ie driveways, paths, fencing, guttering. Properties will be occupied during any works instructed.   Some refurbishment works remain required across the portfolio and this relates mainly to Kitchens and Bathrooms.  A new contract under the Fusion 21 Framework for Building Improvements Lot 9 is being established  While the works identified for Financial Years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 are Kitchens and Bathrooms which are covered by Lot 1; flexibility is required for any other works which may fall under Lots 2/3/4/5/6/7/8 which are identified as required either during the period ending 31/3/2027 or during the optional extension periods; hence the use of Lot 9.  The contract award for an initial period ending 31/3/2027 with options to extend for a further 36 months in increments of not less than 6 months, for any future works.  The budget identified for the initial period of works 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 is Â£250k per annum.  The budget availability for the optional extension period/s is unknown at this stage.

tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.summary: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides globa
tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Technical Support Products, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.title: 704399451-93 - MSS/142 MRO089_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Marine Electrical, Power and Distribution items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.summary: Specialised Commissioning historically funded a small number of clinical registries and audits related to specialised services, with arrangements predating NHS England. After 2013, NHSE became respons
tenders.detailedDescription: Specialised Commissioning historically funded a small number of clinical registries and audits related to specialised services, with arrangements predating NHS England. After 2013, NHSE became responsible for several of these databases, though oversight remained regional until 2018/19. To strengthen governance and strategic direction, funding has since been centralised nationally. As these registries are essential for specialised commissioning- holding unique clinical data and supporting service identification-approval is sought to extend current funding arrangements for 18 months to ensure continuity and stability.

tenders.title: 704399451-38 - MSS/142 MRO046_CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Marine Electrical Power items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: PDaTS - Maritime Post Design and Technical Services. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaries (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide Post Design and Technical Services to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 28 suppliers. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Safety and Environmental Support Activity, Call-off price withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.detailedDescription: The project focuses on the modernisation of key areas of Coalville Library, including a full redesign of the children's area with flexible furniture, updated shelving, improved seating, and a sensory space. The foyer and counter area will be reconfigured to create a more accessible and welcoming entrance. The main library space will receive new flooring, shelving, seating, and display areas, with an option to update the PC zone. Exterior works will enhance the building faÃ§ade to improve visibility and overall appeal.

The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Marine Fire Evacuation and Survival items. tenders.title: Inclusive Travel SaaS Product
tenders.summary: For many people, buses represent the most affordable and accessible mode of transport. Those on low or fixed incomes depend on them to access health, education and employment. But for some, there are
tenders.detailedDescription: For many people, buses represent the most affordable and accessible mode of transport. Those on low or fixed incomes depend on them to access health, education and employment. But for some, there are barriers which make it more difficult to use public transport. These barriers can be physical (for example infrastructure) and access to information (for example timetables or journey planning information). For some groups, such barriers can reduce their travel horizons and lead them to spend more on alternative modes such as a taxi.

tenders.title: 704399451-55 - MSS/142 MRO065 - CAN
tenders.summary: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global suppo
tenders.detailedDescription: MRO - Maritime Maintenance, Repair & Overhaul. The Power, Propulsion and Auxiliaies (PPA) Team, which is part of the ships operating centre within Defence Equipment Support (DES) provides global support to the Royal Navy. PPA has set up a Framework agreement to provide maintenance, repair and overhaul to Royal Naval Platforms through an established set of suppliers. There is a possibility that during the life of the proposed contract that the size of HM Naval Fleet may increase or decrease. The support contract took the form of a Framework arrangement and has been awarded under DSPCR 2011 regulations. Call-Off contracts were awarded to 16 suppliers via call-off competitions. Mini-Competitions are held throughout the life of the framework agreement. This mini-competition was for the provision of Marine Electrical Power items. The awarded call-off contract value was determined subsequent to a competitive exercise undertaken in accordance with the framework terms. The overall framework contract runs to 31 March 2031 and has a maximum value of Â£317m.The call-off contract value is withheld due to commercial sensitivities and the ongoing competitive nature of the Framework.

tenders.summary: SCDC is looking for a suitable contractor to run a mobile food hub, servicing initially 8 different villages, and rising depending on its success. In 2023, 6 villages were initially identified to star
tenders.detailedDescription: SCDC is looking for a suitable contractor to run a mobile food hub, servicing initially 8 different villages, and rising depending on its success. In 2023, 6 villages were initially identified to start the mobile food hub using the indices of deprivation data from the 2021 census, targeting wards with the highest level of households deprived in two or more dimensions without close access to a foodbank. These villages/wards were Papworth, Over & Willingham, Histon & Impington, Fen Ditton & Fulbourn, Linton, and Duxford. Northstowe was added in 2025. These locations are subject to change dependent on changes in demand.

tenders.summary: National Highways want to trial the Miyawaki method of tree planting to determine whether it's a more successful and more climate resilient method of tree establishment when compared to traditional me
tenders.detailedDescription: National Highways want to trial the Miyawaki method of tree planting to determine whether it's a more successful and more climate resilient method of tree establishment when compared to traditional methods. National Highways would like to trial this method at one of our rest stops in the South West in the form of a 250sqm 'tiny forest'. National Highways want to trial this in rest stop due to the social value benefits that a 'tiny forest' can provide, and these areas are where we have the most direct interaction with the travelling public outside of their vehicles.

tenders.title: S30063 UPS Battery Rollout on Smart Motorways
tenders.summary: The Power Outages Project is being commissioned by Operational Control Division to increase resilience of Technology on Smart Motorways, by reducing the impact of Power Outages. This phase of work is
tenders.detailedDescription: The Power Outages Project is being commissioned by Operational Control Division to increase resilience of Technology on Smart Motorways, by reducing the impact of Power Outages. This phase of work is introducing UPS Systems (consisting of Inverter and Lithium Ion Batteries) to support Operational Technology, with the aim of providing an average of 6 hours resilience against Power Outages. As UPS Systems were not included within the original design of Smart Motorways, the CMDB and DMRB/MCHW will need to be updated to include the option of UPS to support the power supply where it is deemed appropriate. Furthermore, a new product specification is required for the Cabinets to house the new UPS Inverters, Batteries and ancillary equipment. This Work Order aims to onboard a service provider to make the relevant document updates, drive these through governance to final approval and contribute to the strategic decisions from a Safety and Engineering Standards perspective that are required to deliver the project.

tenders.title: Social Media monitoring tool
tenders.organization: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation (Ofqual)
tenders.summary: 1.2.3.	Ofqual communications are seeking a comprehensive social and media monitoring platform that combines three core capabilities: social media management (including listening across major platforms
tenders.detailedDescription: 1.2.3.	Ofqual communications are seeking a comprehensive social and media monitoring platform that combines three core capabilities: social media management (including listening across major platforms and forums with sentiment analysis, crisis alerts, content scheduling and publishing and performance analytics), 24/7 media monitoring (providing immediate alerts and cuttings from all national, regional, local and broadcast media, including full access to paywalled publications), and media management tools (with up-to-date journalist databases, distribution list functionality and detailed analytics covering sentiment, reach and share of voice). The solution must include a dedicated account manager and training, provide both historical data access for year-on-year comparisons, have the ability to generate visual reports, all whilst maintaining reliable service standards.

tenders.title: 24/019 Holloway Lodge Roof Repairs & Tree Root Removal - AWARD
tenders.summary: Tamworth Council is looking for a suitably qualified and experienced builder with proven experience of working on Scheduled Monuments or Listed Buildings to undertake roofing repair works to Holloway
tenders.detailedDescription: Tamworth Council is looking for a suitably qualified and experienced builder with proven experience of working on Scheduled Monuments or Listed Buildings to undertake roofing repair works to Holloway Lodge and a tree stump removal near a Grade II listed building and wall. Holloway Lodge is a Grade II listed lodge dating from 1810 and serves as the gatehouse for the south western entrance to Tamworth Castle grounds (Staffordshire B79 7NB).  It is located within the context of Tamworth Castle which is a Grade I listed building. The castle and grounds are also a Registered Scheduled Monument. As such alterations to the fabric are subject to listed building consent and works within the boundary of the Schedule Monument are also subject to Scheduled Monument Consent.

tenders.summary: The Council's current contract for the provision of 16+ Supported Accommodation service operating in the Locality (as defined below) expired on 31 July 2022. The Council has awarded new contracts for
tenders.detailedDescription: The Council's current contract for the provision of 16+ Supported Accommodation service operating in the Locality (as defined below) expired on 31 July 2022. The Council has awarded new contracts for the provision of 16+ Supported Accommodation service in the Locality which commenced on the 1 August 2022, but the Council was unable to award all contracts during the original procurement exercise and a second procurement exercise commenced in February 2022 and resulted in the award of contracts for all but one of the services. However, the acquisition or development of accommodation to fulfil the requirements of the specification will take some time and as a result an interim contract was required to avoid a gap in provision for looked after children and care leavers in the south of the County (Gedling, Broxtowe and Rushcliffe) and Ashfield.

tenders.title: Contact Centre Management System
tenders.summary: Leeds Federated is seeking to appoint a suitably skilled and experienced contact centre management system provider to supply and maintain an effective inbound and outbound communications platform.  Le
tenders.detailedDescription: Leeds Federated is seeking to appoint a suitably skilled and experienced contact centre management system provider to supply and maintain an effective inbound and outbound communications platform.  Leeds Federated currently have a small but growing Customer Service team with 12 users including operatives, staff with supervisory system access, and a contact centre manager.  In addition to the core customer contact centre,  Staff in the Leeds Federated Income team, and Neighbourhood team require access to a system which also allows for incoming and outgoing call management.  In line with current and future requirements over the next three years, Leeds Federated is seeking a contract management system with the ability to service up to 50 users concurrently via VOIP, ideally via a desktop platform in addition to a mobile solution.Leeds Federated are seeking to appoint a partner that can meet current and future requirements in terms of providing a leading customer contact solution for both inbound and outbound communication primarily in terms of voice calls, but also via alternative media.  Leeds Federated understand that an effective contact management platform has the ability to add significant value to the levels of customer service offered, and as such is seeking a solution that is simple to use, intuitive, and offers high levels of statistical insight, both in terms of customer contact, but also operative behaviour.Further details are contained within the tender documents.

tenders.title: Case Officer Assurance Support
tenders.summary: This contract is for the provision of Case Officer Assurance Services to support the Defence Medical Information Services (MedIS) within the CORTISONE Programme. The supplier will deliver assurance su
tenders.detailedDescription: This contract is for the provision of Case Officer Assurance Services to support the Defence Medical Information Services (MedIS) within the CORTISONE Programme. The supplier will deliver assurance support and expert advice across all workstreams, including CORTISONE, Live Service, and DMICP, addressing critical skills shortages within the Buyer's organisation. The service will encompass early engagement with projects, review of technical and business requirements, risk identification, and the development of assurance strategies aligned with Defence Enterprise Architectures and MOD policies. Key deliverables include guidance and assessment, support to design reviews,technical release readiness assessments, reporting, collaboration, audit register maintenance, and data analysis to ensure compliance, quality, and operational performance.

Certain information relating to the software and the supplier have been withheld under Regulation 108 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 on the basis that disclosure would impede law enforcement. The contract is for an initial period of 12 months with the option to extend for a further 12 months.  The values provided are for the annual cost excluding VAT  for the initial period and the higher value is if the optional extension period is taken again excluding VAT.
